ovdesc.p: This application is used to only test the rounding rule definition.
The following fields may be input:
Once the record is verified, the application uses the rounding rule definition to perform the rounding accordingly on that amount.
o The rounding parameter used for the rounding
o The rounding type used for the rounding
o The Minimum unit used if one has been defined.

desc.p: This defines whether a rounding rule is to be used for the rounding calculation.
If it is not set then the TEST.ROUNDING uses the rounding definition at the Currency level defined in the TEST.ROUNDING record.

If it is set then, the application fetches the rounding rule information defining the rounding type and any minimum unit to be used. The other required information are retrieved from the Currency record.
· Either left blank or a valid Id to EB.ROUNDING.RULE.
Key to TEST.ROUNDING application.
Key can be alphanumberic.
Minimum of 3 characters.
Key can have a maximum of 35 characters.
This field indicates what parameter has been used for the rounding. The possible values are ‘ROUNDING.RULE’ and ‘CURRENCY’.
If no rounding rule has been defined in the TEST.ROUNDING record, then ‘CURRENCY’ is returned.
If a rounding rule has been defined in the TEST.ROUNDING record, then ‘ROUNDING.RULE’ is returned.
The only exception is when the ROUNDING.TYPE in the EB.ROUNDING.RULE is set to ‘CURRENCY’ or ‘NONE’, in this case ‘CURRENCY’ is returned.
· It is a non-input field. The possible returned values are ‘CURRENCY’ and ‘ROUNDING.RULE’
This indicates the type of rounding that has been effected on the input amount.
The following values may be returned:
A value of ‘1’, indicates a natural rounding has been effected
A value of ‘2’, indicates a rounding down has been effected
A value of ‘3’, indicates a rounding up has been effected.
· It is a non-input field. The possible returned values are ‘1’, ‘2’, ‘3’.
This is the un-rounded amount on which the test is performed.
· Up to 19 type AMT characters. (Standard amount format.)
This is the rounded amount returned by the TEST.ROUNDING, once the record has been verified.
· Up to 19 type AMT characters. (Standard amount format.)
· It is a non-input field
Identifies the Currency of the amount to be rounded. Any other rounding definition such as, NO.OF.DECIMALS, CASH.ONLY.ROUNDING, MIN.ROUND.AMOUNT are fetched from the currency record as defined here.
· 3 type SSS (uppercase alpha) character or 1-3 numeric character Currency code.
· It must be an existing code on the CURRENCY Table.
This describes the TEST.ROUNDING record
This indicates whether the minimum amount, or the lowest unit of currency defined in the TEST.ROUNDING, has been used for rounding the input amount.
The TEST.ROUNDING application either returns blank or the actual minimum unit used for the rounding.
If this field is returned with a blank, then the rounding has been done to the NO.OF.DECIMAL.PLACES in the Currency record.

Note: Even if in the Currency record a MIN.ROUND.AMOUNT is defined and if in the EB.ROUNDING.RULE, the USE.MIN.UNIT has not been set to ‘Y’ , then the NO.OF.DECIMAL.PLACES in the Currency record is used.
In this case a blank value is returned in the field MIN.ROUND.AMT.
